verses.text: At that time Abijah the son of Jeroboam fell sick.

And Jeroboam said to his wife , Arise , I pray thee, and disguise thyself, that thou be not known to be the wife of Jeroboam ; and get thee to Shiloh : behold, there \add is\add* Ahijah the prophet , which told me that \add I should be\add* king over this people.

And take with thee ten loaves , and cracknels , and a cruse of honey , and go to him: he shall tell thee what shall become of the child.\f + \fr 14.3 \ft with…: Heb. in thine hand\f*\f + \fr 14.3 \ft cracknels: or, cakes\f*\f + \fr 14.3 \ft cruse: or, bottle\f*

And Jeroboam’s wife did so , and arose , and went to Shiloh , and came to the house of Ahijah. But Ahijah could not see ; for his eyes were set by reason of his age.\f + \fr 14.4 \ft were…: Heb. stood for his hoariness\f* \p

¶ And the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* said unto Ahijah , Behold, the wife of Jeroboam cometh to ask a thing of thee for her son ; for he \add is\add* sick : thus and thus shalt thou say unto her: for it shall be, when she cometh in , that she shall feign herself \add to be\add* another \add woman\add*.

And it was \add so\add*, when Ahijah heard the sound of her feet , as she came in at the door , that he said , Come in , thou wife of Jeroboam ; why feignest thou thyself \add to be\add* another ? for I \add am\add* sent to thee \add with\add* heavy \add tidings\add*.\f + \fr 14.6 \ft heavy: Heb. hard\f* \p
Go , tell Jeroboam , Thus saith the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* God of Israel , Forasmuch as I exalted thee from among the people , and made thee prince over my people Israel ,

And rent the kingdom away from the house of David , and gave it thee: and \add yet\add* thou hast not been as my servant David , who kept my commandments , and who followed me with all his heart , to do \add that\add* only \add which was\add* right in mine eyes ;
But hast done evil above all that were before thee: for thou hast gone and made thee other gods , and molten images , to provoke me to anger , and hast cast me behind thy back :

Therefore, behold, I will bring evil upon the house of Jeroboam , and will cut off from Jeroboam him that pisseth against the wall , \add and\add* him that is shut up and left in Israel , and will take away the remnant of the house of Jeroboam , as a man taketh away dung , till it be all gone.
Him that dieth of Jeroboam in the city shall the dogs eat ; and him that dieth in the field shall the fowls of the air eat : for the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* hath spoken \add it\add*.
Arise thou therefore, get thee to thine own house : \add and\add* when thy feet enter into the city , the child shall die.

And all Israel shall mourn for him, and bury him: for he only of Jeroboam shall come to the grave , because in him there is found \add some\add* good thing toward the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* God of Israel in the house of Jeroboam.
Moreover the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* shall raise him up a king over Israel , who shall cut off the house of Jeroboam that day : but what? even now.

For the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* shall smite Israel , as a reed is shaken in the water , and he shall root up Israel out of this good land , which he gave to their fathers , and shall scatter them beyond the river , because they have made their groves , provoking the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* to anger.
And he shall give Israel up because of the sins of Jeroboam , who did sin , and who made Israel to sin. \p
¶ And Jeroboam’s wife arose , and departed , and came to Tirzah : \add and\add* when she came to the threshold of the door , the child died ;
And they buried him; and all Israel mourned for him, according to the word of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, which he spake by the hand of his servant Ahijah the prophet.
And the rest of the acts of Jeroboam , how he warred , and how he reigned , behold, they \add are\add* written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Israel.
And the days which Jeroboam reigned \add were\add* two and twenty years : and he slept with his fathers , and Nadab his son reigned in his stead.\f + \fr 14.20 \ft slept: Heb. lay down\f* \p

¶ And Rehoboam the son of Solomon reigned in Judah. Rehoboam \add was\add* forty and one years old when he began to reign , and he reigned seventeen years in Jerusalem , the city which the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* did choose out of all the tribes of Israel , to put his name there. And his mother’s name \add was\add* Naamah an Ammonitess.
And Judah did evil in the sight of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, and they provoked him to jealousy with their sins which they had committed , above all that their fathers had done.
For they also built them high places , and images , and groves , on every high hill , and under every green tree.\f + \fr 14.23 \ft images: or, standing images, or, statues\f*

And there were also sodomites in the land : \add and\add* they did according to all the abominations of the nations which the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* cast out before the children of Israel. \p
¶ And it came to pass in the fifth year of king Rehoboam , \add that\add* Shishak king of Egypt came up against Jerusalem :

And he took away the treasures of the house of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, and the treasures of the king’s house ; he even took away all: and he took away all the shields of gold which Solomon had made.

And king Rehoboam made in their stead brasen shields , and committed \add them\add* unto the hands of the chief of the guard , which kept the door of the king’s house.\f + \fr 14.27 \ft guard: Heb. runners\f*
And it was \add so\add*, when the king went into the house of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, that the guard bare them, and brought them back into the guard chamber. \p
¶ Now the rest of the acts of Rehoboam , and all that he did , \add are\add* they not written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Judah ?
And there was war between Rehoboam and Jeroboam all \add their\add* days.

And Rehoboam slept with his fathers , and was buried with his fathers in the city of David. And his mother’s name \add was\add* Naamah an Ammonitess. And Abijam his son reigned in his stead.\f + \fr 14.31 \ft Abijam: also called, Abijah: Gr. Abia\f*
